data.question: What is the unique shape of the dinuclear connector described in the text?
What type of synthesis approach is used for the CPs E1,2?
What are the coordination numbers and geometries of the metal atoms in the F-shaped connector?
data.answer: Tricoordinated CuI center with a trigonal-planar geometry and a tetracoordinated CuI center with a tetrahedral geometry

data.question: What is the role of the dppm-capped CuI nodes in the CPs?
data.answer: They organize nanosized p-conjugated systems into CPs having p-stacked metallocyclophane motifs

data.question: What is the significance of the p-stacked metallocyclophane motifs in the CPs?
data.answer: They have unique electronic properties arising from p-orbital overlap

data.question: What is the yield of CP E2 from the synthesis described in the Experimental Section?
What is the purpose of using the U-shaped CuI dimer A in the synthesis of the p-stacked metalloparacyclophanes C1,2?
data.answer: To self-assemble with the cyano-capped p-conjugated systems B1,2 to synthesize the metalloparacyclophanes C1,2

data.question: How does the mixed-coordination connector contribute to the structure of the CPs?
data.answer: It allows for the propagation of the coordination geometry using p-conjugated linkers, giving CP frameworks with p-stacked metalloparacyclophanes as structural motifs

data.question: Why are the CPs E1,2 obtained in excellent yields with different original CuI/dppm/B1,2 ratios?
data.answer: Because the three simple building blocks can self-assemble into large and complex CP architectures from a library of interconverting CuI complexes, irrespective of the original stoichiometry

data.question: What is the effect of changing the counteranion from PF6- to BF4- in the synthesis of CPs?
data.answer: It affects the solubility of the CuI species, leading to the formation of different compounds

data.question: What demonstrates the flexibility of the dppm-capped CuI nodes?
data.answer: The fact that the Cu···Cu separation decreases in E1,2 compared to D

data.question: How does the structure of the CPs differ when using biphenyl cores versus 2,5-distyrylthiophene cores?
data.answer: The biphenyl cores of CP H are twisted, while the 2,5-distyrylthiophene moieties of CP I lie in parallel planes

data.question: The F-shaped connectors are based on coordinatively saturated and unsaturated CuI centers. True or False?
The CPs E1,2 are synthesized using a two-step process. True or False?
The p-stacked metalloparacyclophanes C1,2 are synthesized without the use of a U-shaped CuI dimer. True or False?
The CPs E1,2 have nanosized p-stacked metalloparacyclophane units connected by rigid ditopic linkers B1,2. True or False?
The CPs E1,2, H, and I all contain F-shaped mixed-coordination {Cu2(m2-dppm)2} nodes. True or False?
The synthesis of CPs E1,2 requires a high temperature. True or False?
The CPs E1,2 are obtained by the self-assembly of self-assembled nanostructures. True or False?
The presence of paracyclophane like motifs and unsaturated CuI centers in the CPs are not under active investigation. True or False?
